thread.title: Multiple children charged in Columbus teen’s drowning
thread.title_full: Multiple children charged in Columbus teen’s drowning

author: WTVM Web Team
title: Multiple children charged in Columbus teen’s drowning
text: Multiple children charged in Columbus teen’s drowning COLUMBUS, Ga. (WTVM) - Several children are facing charges in the drowning of a Columbus teen. The body of Zahmere Greene, 15, was [found in a pond near the Oakland Park area ](https://www.wtvm.com/2024/06/02/officials-identify-body-found-pond-oakland-park-columbus/)on May 27, according to Muscogee County coroner Buddy Bryan. Police say their investigation indicates Greene drowned on May 23, but the incident wasn’t reported until several days later. Police said the investigation also revealed that several juveniles witnessed the incident, which led to the following charges: - Juvenile, 11 years old - involuntary manslaughter and concealing the death of another - Shane Sano, 17 years old - concealing the death of another (charged as an adult, case bound over to Superior Court) - Juvenile, 11 years old - concealing the death of another - Juvenile, 11 years old - concealing the death of another - Juvenile, 9 years old - concealing the death of another - Juvenile, 12 years old - concealing the death of another According to police, the 11-year-old facing the manslaughter charge is being held in the Regional Youth Detention Center, while the 17-year-old is in the Muscogee County Jail. Authorities added that the other juveniles were processed and released to their parents. Copyright 2024 WTVM. All rights reserved.
